definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: This allows you to borrow up to 25% more than its appraised value.
sentences.chinese: 這讓你借取高達25%以上的鑑定價值。

sentences.english: There will be no onsite access to the collection.
sentences.chinese: 將不可在庫內直接借取藏書。

sentences.english: So how much did these investment companies borrow and then lend?
sentences.chinese: 那麼這些投資公司借取和貸出多少資金呢？

sentences.english: Vaccines. Vaccines should be borrowed from local stocks if available.
sentences.chinese: 疫苗應當儘量從當地庫存中借取。

definition: to lend/to put out a loan
to demand payment/to extort/to trace/to seek/to pursue/to explore
to deposit (e.g. in a bank account)
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
to borrow money for a short time
to receive for storage/delivery of goods/to gather and store/to store safely/safe keeping
so as to/for the purpose of/in order to
to flow into/to converge (of river)/(computing) to import (data)
to rely on sb for support
